content:
It sounds like Thunderbird might be applying a filter or view setting that hides read emails unless they’re starred. You can try this:

In the folder, click on the filter drop-down (usually says “Unread”) and change it to “All.”

Check “View → Sort by” to ensure messages aren’t being grouped or hidden.

If that doesn’t work, back up your profile and try “Properties → Repair Folder” again to re-index.

Sometimes in tech (just like in life), the information is right there—it’s just hidden until we look at it from the right angle. It’s a bit like the way surah yaseen reminds us that clarity comes when we take the time to truly understand what’s in front of us. Visit: www.Suraheyaseen.com
creator: jawadulhassan1810

In the folder, click on the filter drop-down (usually says “Unread”) and change it to “All.”

Check “View → Sort by” to ensure messages aren’t being grouped or hidden.

If that doesn’t work, back up your profile and try “Properties → Repair Folder” again to re-index.

content:
If you're using Bitdefender antivirus, it might be caused by that. Note that disabling only Bitdefender Antispam will not help. Try this, which may or may not work:

Open Bitdefender 

- go to Protection > Online Threat Prevention > toggle off the 'Encrypted web scan' setting

New messages downloaded after that will hopefully be OK. However, old messages already downloaded to Thunderbird cannot be fixed. If old messages are still on your pop server, you can try downloading them again.

If you're using another antivirus, try disabling it and see what happens.
creator: siffemoz

content: Try TB menu > View > Folders > Folder Pane Header.
creator: siffemoz
